com.acme.core

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acme.core.Utilities

  • public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class created to have multipurpose methods available to other classes.
    Author:
    Carlos Gonzales

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String[] BELL_SCHEDULE
      An array containing the Poolesville High School bell schedule
      static java.lang.String[] HEADERS
      An array containing the headers used by the MSExporter class and its subclasses.

      • getRandomColor

        public static java.awt.Color getRandomColor(int low,
                            int high)
        Gets a random color with RGB values between 0 and 255.
        Parameters:
        low - - the lower bound for the color, cannot be greater than 255 or less than 0
        high - - the upper bound for each color, cannot be greater than 255 or less than 0
        Returns:
        a random color with RGB values between 0 and 255
        Throws:
        IllegalArugmentException - if the arguments are not between 0 and 255, inclusive

      • read

                      int max)
        Reads the given number of lines from the file specified by path.
        Parameters:
        path - - the path specifying the file to be read
        max - - the number of lines that should be read from the file
        Returns:
        a String array of length max containing the lines read from path
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if path does not point to a valid file
        See Also:
        BufferedReader}, {@link FileReader}

      • getContrastColor

        public static java.awt.Color getContrastColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Gets the contrast Color for color using perceptive luminance.
        Parameters:
        color - - the color for which to find the contrast
        Returns:
        Color.WHITE or Color.BLACK, whichever is most contrasting to color

      • getContrastColor

        public static int getContrastColor(int[] vals)
        Gets the contrast for the given RGB values in vals.
        Parameters:
        vals - - the RGB values for which to find a contrast
        Returns:
        0, which indicates a black contrast should be used, or 1, which indicates a white font should be used
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if vals.length < 3

      • addSpacers

        public static void addSpacers(java.awt.Container container,
              int numPanels)
        Adds a number of spacer JPanel's to the given Container. Implemented for use with GridLayout.
        Parameters:
        container - - a Container to which JPanel's should be added
        numPanels - - the number of JPanel's to add
        See Also:
        Container}, {@link JPanel}, {@link GridLayout}

                              java.lang.String ext)
        Checks to see if the extension given by ext is equal to the given File's extension.
        Parameters:
        file - - the File object to check
        ext - - the extension to check for
        Returns:
        a File object guaranteed to have the same path as file with an extension equal to ext

      • getTokenValue

        public static java.lang.String getTokenValue(java.lang.String id)
        Gets the first token that begins with the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - - the identifier to search for in the information file
        Returns:
        a String containing the value for the first token that begins with id, or null if no such token exists

      • getTokenValues

        Gets all the tokens that begin with the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - - the identifier to search for in the information file
        Returns:
        a String[] array containing all tokens that begin with id
